conbody.p: In this guide, you'll explore some of the possibilities the can offer to plan tests, organize tests, and analyze test reports.

li.p: You have created a Katalon account.
You have connected a Git repository for your project. To learn how to connect the Git repository to your project, refer to this document: .

section.title: #1 Plan tests
section.p: The test planning features in allow you to check release readiness and requirement coverage. To utilize this feature to the best of its capabilities, it is advised that you integrate with Jira. To learn more about TestOps - Jira integration, you can refer to this document: .
Once Jira integration is enabled, you can:

li.p: Populate Jira releases. See: Populate Jira releases.
Link test cases to Jira requirements. See: Link test cases to Jira requirements.

section.p: After creating a release, you can link test runs to a release. See: .

li.p: If you haven't created any test runs, you can refer to the on-boarding document for testers: .

section.p: The following picture shows the Planning > Releases tab after linking test runs to Jira releases. Here you can see the status of each release and its readiness.
The following picture shows the Planning > Requirements tab after linking test cases to Jira requirements. also provides test case coverage and traceability matrix reports.
If you have enabled BDD configuration in , you can also quickly check BDD test results in the Requirement tab. Refer to: .

section.title: #2 Organize your test cases
section.p: In , you must first upload your test scripts using the Git repositories to . See: . This allows you to manage version control and synchronization in the .

After uploading your test scripts from the Git repository, you can organize your tests in test suites or dynamic test suites.
To manage your tests in . See: .
To manage your tests in . See:
If you want to run parallel tests with multiple browsers, you can add and manage your test suites in a test suite collection. See: .

section.title: #3 Analyze test reports
section.p: provides several ways to gain a clear view of the overall readiness of your projects.
As part of your daily tasks, use the dedicated reports available in our TestOps dashboard to evaluate your testing progress.

row.entry:
Shows your testing activities in daily/weekly/monthly periods.
This enables faster troubleshooting and assists you in the decision-making process of your product cycle. See: .

Shows how ready your releases are. This allows you to:
Evaluate the status of the two most recent releases.
Oversee your release plan with reminders of the delivery date.
Monitor productivity to see progress in development and testing.
Highlight the total number of defects for each release.See: .
Tracks the total number of test cases you have created in your project in a daily/weekly/monthly period. See: .
Shows the test quality based on Flakiness Test Distribution (the distribution of test cases by their flakiness probability). See: .
Shows the coverage of test runs or test results executed in corresponding environments. See: .

entry.p: Provides the coverage status of requirements for a given scope. This allows you to centralize all Jira and BDD requirements in one single place for reports and analytics. See: .

row.entry: Shows the number of online and offline agents and the distribution of all agents by the operating system. See: .
